content: Southeast Asian venture capital firm **Golden Gate Ventures** is a Singaporean [venture capital firm](/wiki/Venture_capital_firm), founded in 2011 by Vinnie Lauria, Jeffrey Paine, and [Paul Bragiel](/wiki/Paul_Bragiel) that invests in Southeast Asia. The company is headquartered in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), with offices in [Jakarta](/wiki/Jakarta), [Hanoi](/wiki/Hanoi), and [Ho Chi Minh City](/wiki/Ho_Chi_Minh_City). Golden Gate Ventures invests in early-stage tech [startups](/wiki/Startups). Its investments range span social commerce, healthtech, entertainment, marketplaces, agritech, entertainment, and [fintech](/wiki/Fintech). ## History Golden Gate Ventures was accepted into the Singapore Government's [Technology Incubation Scheme](/wiki/Technology_Incubation_Scheme) in 2013. In 2022, Golden Gate Ventures opened offices in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City, [Vietnam](/wiki/Vietnam). This [Singaporean corporation or company](/wiki/List_of_companies_of_Singapore) article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Golden Gate Ventures
